title: Scientific Inquiry-Based Educational Content Development for Mobile Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience and mobile device proficiency, fundamental understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation–experimentation–observation–analysis–conclusion)
context.additional_context: Real-time collaboration and feedback-centered environment for strengthening science education content development capabilities for current practitioners. Particularly emphasizes variable control during experiment design and evidence-based conclusion-drawing

learning_goals: By applying layout design methods that enhance readability of science content tailored to mobile device characteristics, the efficiency of visualizing experimental processes and observational data can be improved.
Using responsive design principles, educational materials compatible with various screen sizes can be produced, and the relationship between scientific variables and results can be clearly expressed.

By designing mobile-optimized interactive elements (e.g., quizzes, drag-and-drop) to simulate the hypothesis verification process, both learner engagement and scientific analytical skills can be simultaneously enhanced.

resources: Mobile Devices (Provided), LMS System, H5P Tool, Canva Design Tool

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
